1: (0) For the leader. On machalat. A maskil of David:
2: (1) A brutish fool tells himself, “There isn't any God.” Such people are depraved, all their deeds are vile, not one of them does what is good.
3: (2) God looks out from heaven upon the human race to see if even one is wise, if even one seeks God.
4: (3) Every one of them is unclean, altogether corrupt; not one of them does what is good, not a single one.
5: (4) Won't these evildoers ever learn? They devour my people as if they were eating bread, and they never call on God!
6: (5) They will be gripped with terror, even though now they are not afraid; for God will scatter the bones of him who is besieging you. You are putting them to shame, because God has rejected them.
7: (6) If only salvation for Isra'el would come out of Tziyon! When God restores his people's fortunes, what joy for Ya'akov! what gladness for Isra'el!
